sub_title: PhD Candidate - Visual Art & Climate Change
summary:
www.imaginehumannature.art
Instagram: ulrikepaula.hahn

Since 2019: PhD in the Humanities grant to research visual art and climate change at Erasmus School of History, Culture and Communication, Erasmus University Rotterdam.

2016-2018: I studied MA Arts, Culture and Society and MSc Global Business & Sustainability in the EUR Excellence Scholarship program at Erasmus University Rotterdam, graduating cum laude, with the aim to bridge the art & culture sector and sustainability. 

I am continuing the creative collaboration with/about Daniel Schinasi, and am working on my own artistic inquiries, mainly visual art. 
In June 2022, I received the NWO Synergy Award to kickstart the implementation of my idea ResearchIN' Comics - research-based comics!

projects:
[{'title': 'Organisation of own exhibition “Trouver la Liberte” / “Finding Freedom” in Paris and creation of accompanying book', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': "Inspired by artist Daniel Schinasi's story of becoming a successful artist, even under the worst conditions of war and crisis, I organized an exhibition in Paris. It included my own photographies, texts and short movies surrounding the topic of Finding Freedom and I hosted a talk between the audience and artist Daniel Schinasi about his life ad life's works. After the exhibition, I created a book mostly featuring photographs  I took, short stories I wrote and interviews I conducted with Daniel Schinasi. ", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ulrike', 'last_name': 'Hahn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'PhD Candidate - Visual Art & Climate Change'}]}, {'title': 'Participating team in John Molson Case Competition Montreal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ulrike', 'last_name': 'Hahn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'PhD Candidate - Visual Art & Climate Change'}]}, {'title': 'Participating team and runner-up in Citi International Case Competition Hong Kong', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Citi International Case Competition in Hong Kong invited 24 international teams. 
Our team consisted of team members specialising in finance, strategy and marketing. My role was marketing consultant. 
We achieved second place out of the 24 teams.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ulrike', 'last_name': 'Hahn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'PhD Candidate - Visual Art & Climate Change'}]}, {'title': 'Production of 2 documentaries about life and work of artist & social change agent Daniel Schinasi', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': "The first short film is about Daniel Schinasi's story of fleeing his country of birth due to war and crisis and how he became a successful painter and important advocate of peace and reconciliation.
The second short film is about the making of the sculpture of Elio Toaff by Daniel Schinasi. The artist explains his ambitions and techniques for creating this sculpture for the community of Cecina in Italy close to which Elio Toaff was born. It is an excellent example of a meaningful public art experience.
A third short film is currently in the making. 
The created documentaries were exhibited at cultural institutions, amongst others in Vienna, Paris (2015), Cecina, Madrid (2016), Nice, Belgrade (2017).", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ulrike', 'last_name': 'Hahn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'PhD Candidate - Visual Art & Climate Change'}]}]
